page.title: 06Litlington Church E.Sussex
page.content: Litlington Church which is of Norman origin and dated about 1150 A.D. stands on rising ground at one end of the village.The original roof beams can still be seen;stained glass windows in the chancel and a tablet to the memory of Thomas Scutt 1853. There are several old tombs in the churchyard dated about 1767,one belonging to the Bean family 1789-1825 There is a cross to the memory of General C.J.La Trobe C.B.first Lieut. Governor of the colony of Victoria, Australia.There are attractive prayer kneelers in the pews which were hand embroidered by the local ladies in 1981,all depicting the local church. The land behind the churchyard falls away to water meadows through which the River Cuckmere winds.In winter these are flooded and are full of water fowl and sea birds.
